docs.snippet: Julius J. Epstein, a screenwriter of sharp, sardonic dialogue who won an Academy Award for the script of ''Casablanca,'' died here on Saturday. He was 91.    Mr. Epstein wrote more than 50 movies in a 50-year career. He and his identical twin, Phi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Julius J. Epstein, a screenwriter of sharp, sardonic dialogue who won an Academy Award for the script of ''Casablanca,'' died here on Saturday. He was 91. Mr. Epstein wrote more than 50 movies in a 50-year career. He and his identical twin, Philip, were responsible for the wit and cynicism of ''Casablanca,'' while Howard Koch, who shared the 1943 Academy Award with them, provided much of the film's ardent patriotism.
docs.abstract: Julius J Epstein, screenwriter of sharp, sardonic dialogue who won Academy Award for script of Casablanca, dies at age of 91; he wrote more than 50 movies in 50-year career; photo (M)

headline.main: Julius Epstein, Prolific Screenwriter Who Helped Give 'Casablanca' Its Zest, Dies at 91

docs.section_name: Movies; Obituaries; New York and Region

docs.snippet: MOSS-Alan M. Beloved husband of Janet and the late Florence. Devoted father of Maggie and Jacob Rand, Patricia and Robert MossVreeland. Loving grandfather of Freya, Gabriel, Etan, Forrest, Elie and Jonah. Dear stepfather of Ann and Oscar. Service ...
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSS-Alan M. Beloved husband of Janet and the late Florence. Devoted father of Maggie and Jacob Rand, Patricia and Robert MossVreeland. Loving grandfather of Freya, Gabriel, Etan, Forrest, Elie and Jonah. Dear stepfather of Ann and Oscar. Service Tuesday, 10 AM, Plaza Memorial, 91st St. and Amsterdam Avenue.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  MOSS, ALAN M.
